alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe; Niagara; Northern Erie; Orleans; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 2:19PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHERN WYOMING...NORTHEASTERN ERIE...SOUTHERN NIAGARA...SOUTHERN ORLEANS...SOUTHWESTERN MONROE AND GENESEE COUNTIES... At 215 PM EST, a band of heavy snow extended across the Buffalo Metro eastward across Genesee County into western Monroe county. The area of snow was drifting north at 15 mph. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Batavia, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Brockport, East Aurora, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Elma, Pendleton and Marilla. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 47 and 56. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this band of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions as even more travelled roads are becoming snow covered. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements.
